references.paper_title: A survey of very large-scale neighborhood search techniques
references.reason: This paper provides a foundational overview of very large-scale neighborhood search techniques, which are relevant to the multi-winner reconfiguration problem's optimization aspects.

references.paper_title: Computational aspects of multi-winner approval voting
references.reason: This paper is crucial as it analyzes computational complexity issues in multi-winner approval voting, which directly relate to the computational complexity analysis in the target paper.

references.paper_title: On the computation of fully proportional representation
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant due to its focus on the computation of fully proportional representation, providing key insights into the computational aspects of voting rules used in the main study.

references.paper_title: Mixed integer programming with convex/concave constraints: Fixed-parameter tractability and applications to multicovering and voting
references.reason: This paper is important because it explores the parameterized complexity of mixed integer programming with convex/concave constraints, offering valuable insights into the parameterized complexity analysis conducted in the main paper.
This book provides a comprehensive overview of parameterized algorithmics, a core methodology used in the theoretical analysis of the multi-winner reconfiguration problem's computational complexity.
